publicationStmt.p: Distributed by Digital Scholarship Services at Lafayette College

lg.l: Hail to the Sage, Who from his Native Shore
Produc'd a Science Never known before!
Science of Words once Jargon of the Schools
The plague of Wise Men, and the boast of Fools
Made easy Now & Useful in Yṛ Rules.
Where Wit and humour Equally Combine
Our Mirth at Once to Raise & to Refine;
Till Now Not half the Worth of Sounds We knew
Their Virtual Value, Was Reserv'd for 1Dean Swift You.
To trace their Mazes Various & Set forth
Their hidden force & Multiply their Worth
For if to Express, One Sense Our Words We Chose
A Double Meaning. is of Double Use.Hail Sacred Art! by Wṭ. Misterious Name
Shall I adore, Various, and the Same?
The Muses Proteus, Skill'd with Graceful Change
Through all the pleasing form of Wit to Range
In Quick Succession. Yet Retain thrô all,
Some faint Resemblance of th'Original.Hail fairest Offspring of prodigious birth!
At once the Parent, & the Child of Mirth.
With Chloes Charms. thy airy form can Vie
And With thy Smiles, as Many Thousands Die.
The pleasing pains thrô all their Vitals thrills
With Subtle force & tickles as it Kills.
Thee too, like her the Dying Swains persue
As Gay, as Careless. as Inconstant too:
To Raise Yet More thy Merit & thy fame
The Cyprian Goddess Glories in thy Name
Pleasd to be thought the laughter loving Dame.Nor less thy Praise, Nor less thy Power to WoundThou lovely fleeting Image of a Sound.Y01A388O
